lines.text: Why didn't you tell me I was in love with you?
Miss Brown, what idiot ever told you you were a dancer?
You did.

[her eyes are closed]
What color are my eyes?

[kissing her, causing her to open her eyes in surprise]
Brown.
Nadine, get out all the hounds. We're going for a walk.
A girl dancer has to be exotic; she has to be - a peach.
I suppose I'm a lemon!
[the bartender hands Don his drink]
Can you drown a brunette in this?
How tall is she?
Five foot six.

[filling the glass a little more]
Try this.
I hope I'm intruding.
How did the act go, Mr. Hewes?
One bow.
Too bad.
Tomorrow we'd better get some dogs in the act.
Was I too terrible?
No. No.
I've never really danced before.
You're going to be fine.
Mr. Hewes, Mr. Hewes... You know you don't have to go on with this.
Now look...
No, I mean it. You're the most wonderful dancer I've ever seen. You could get anyone to dance with you. You could get the very best.
I don't want the very best. I want you.

[Lovingly to Hannah]
Do you know that scientists say that people fall in love quickest during a rainstorm? I can prove that. Because that's when I fell in love with you.
What are you doing here by yourself?
Oh, I don't know. I just wanted to get away for awhile.
Sure. Well, if there's anything I can do, breaking one's neck or anything like that, just say the word.
No thanks, Mike. There isn't anything anyone can do.
Ah, don't say that. No man is that important. Plenty of fish left in the sea. You know it's always darkest just...
Oh, Mike. I don't think you have a motto for my kind of problem.
He seems under the impression that you aren't too fond of him.
But I am! Terribly!
Well, I'm afraid it's a little late.
A little late? Little late? Well, that can't be! What'll I do?
Well, if I loved someone, I'd find a way to let them know it.
Well, it's different with a man.
Why?
I don't know. It just is, that's all. It's easier.
